summary: An email from an FBI Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida, with the subject 'Keep an eye on Epstein's planes!!!' and a note that they will call in a few minutes. The document indicates active monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein's aircraft during the investigation.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The email subject references monitoring Epstein's planes, indicating he is the central figure of interest in this investigative activity.

events.title: Monitoring of Epstein's planes ordered
events.description: An FBI Assistant U.S. Attorney sends an email with the subject 'Keep an eye on Epstein's planes!!!' and indicates they will follow up with a phone call.

locations.name: West Palm Beach, FL
locations.context: Location of the FBI Assistant U.S. Attorney sending the email, indicating this is a base for the investigation.

keyFacts: On June 24, 2008, an FBI Assistant U.S. Attorney sent an urgent email with the subject 'Keep an eye on Epstein's planes!!!'
The email indicates active, real-time surveillance or monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein's aircraft was part of the investigation.
The communication originated from West Palm Beach, Florida, which was a key location in the Epstein case.
The 'will call in a few minutes' note suggests immediate follow-up action was planned regarding the aircraft monitoring.
